title: The Times' picks for the March 7 election

text:
The Times' picks for the March 7 election 2503624_ME_0209_Measure_S_IK Los Angeles Times Attendees at a Build Better L.A. Coalition news conference on Feb. 9 let express their views on Measure S, a city ballot measure that would impose a two-year moratorium on developments that need exemptions from land-use rules. Attendees at a Build Better L.A. Coalition news conference on Feb. 9 let express their views on Measure S, a city ballot measure that would impose a two-year moratorium on developments that need exemptions from land-use rules. (Los Angeles Times) The Times Editorial Board 
Los Angeles voters head to the polls on March 7 for the city’s last stand-alone local election. Starting in 2020, city and school board elections will be held in June and November during even-numbered years, together with gubernatorial and presidential elections. 
Here are The Times’ picks for March 7: Los Angeles County ballot measure 
Measure H . A quarter-cent sales tax to fund homeless services: Yes Los Angeles city ballot measures 
Measure M . A city-sponsored plan to tax and regulate marijuana: Yes 
Measure N . An industry-sponsored plan to tax and regulate marijuana: No 
Measure P. Allow 66-year leases, instead of 50-year deals, at the Port of Los Angeles: Yes 
Measure S . Impose a two-year moratorium on developments that need exemptions from land-use rules: No Los Angeles city offices 
Council District 15 : Joe Buscaino Los Angeles Unified School District 
Caption 90 seconds: 4 stories you can't miss 
Police say suspect accused in Whittier officer killing is a poster boy for criminal justice reform , Secretary of State Rex Tillerson and Homeland Security chief John Kelly fly to Mexico , Magic Johnson is now in charge of the Lakers , and the Iraqi government's drive to retake Mosul from Islamic State continues . Caption Protests follow the sentencing of Israeli soldier convicted for killing Palestinian 
A crowd shouts, "if you don't return the boy, we will turn the country upside down, " in protest of the sentencing of Sgt. Elor Azaria who was convicted for fatally shooting Palestinian knife assailant.

An 8-year-old boy is dead after being shot while inside a Pomona residence. The gunfire came from outside the home striking the boy in the head.
